Many stories tell of entrepreneurial miners losing their lives to dighrogh, who are capable of swallowing entire dwarves whole. Dighrogh were once a massive threat to the city in its early years of expansion and are universally despised throughout Ilridun and its populace. Despite the efforts of the Order of the Enlightened Matrons, these creatures continue to survive and threaten miners beneath the city. Clever enough to be dangerous on their own, some dighrogh have also been known to serve powerful, aberrant forces from the Realm Below.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the crab has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it {@status surprised}.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The crab can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Rock-Solid Grip
entries: The crab can climb difficult surfaces made of rock or stone, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Stone Camouflage
entries: The crab has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crab makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) and {@condition restrained} until the grapple ends. The crab has two claws, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Acrid Breath {@recharge}
entries: The crab exhales a pungent, caustic spray in a 30-foot cone. The spray destroys any Tiny nonmagical object in the area that isn't being worn or carried. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) acid damage, and any nonmagical armor or shield that the creature is wearing or carrying takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and any armor or shield it is wearing or carrying is unaffected.

Unlike many of the deep-dwelling creatures of the world that rely on poison, the giant felsic crab utilizes intensely caustic acid to ensnare its prey. This is particularly effective against dwarves and other underground creatures that are often naturally resistant to such poisons. Crafty ambush predators, the felsic crab preys primarily on miners foolhardy enough to venture too far on their own. Stories about miners' narrow escapes from these monstrous crustaceans are pervasive in Ilridun's oral culture, but the rarity of felsic crab carapaces would seem to indicate that most, if not all, such tales are fabricated.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the physiker is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the physiker instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The physiker's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Pointed Strikes (1/Turn)
entries: When the physiker hits a creature with a blowgun needle or unarmed strike, it can choose one of the following options:

items.name: Disable
entries: The next attack roll the target makes before the end of the physiker's next turn is made with disadvantage.

items.name: Expose
entries: The next attack roll made against the target before the end of the physiker's next turn is made with advantage.

trait.name: Stunning Strike {@recharge 5}
entries: When the physiker hits a creature with a melee attack, it can force the target to make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is {@condition stunned} until the end of the physiker's next turn.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the physiker is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The physiker makes three attacks. It can use its Restoring Touch in place of one attack.

action.name: Blowgun Needle
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Embolden (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The physiker casts the {@spell enhance ability} spell. When cast in this way, the spell has a range of 20 feet.

action.name: Restoring Touch (4/Day)
entries: The physiker touches a creature or harmlessly launches a blowgun needle at a creature within 20 feet of it. The target regains 30 ({@dice 4d8 + 12}) hit points.
Once a creature regains hit points in this way, it can't do so again until it finishes a short or long rest.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: When the physiker is hit by a ranged weapon attack, it deflects the missile, reducing the damage it takes from the attack by 19 ({@dice 1d10 + 14}). If the damage is reduced to 0, the physiker catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the physiker has a hand free. It can then make a ranged weapon attack with the caught missile, which has an attack bonus of +7, a normal range of 20 feet, and a long range of 60 feet. On a hit, the target takes 7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) damage of the missile's type.

Although primarily found in the Medica Meridia, anyone can become a physiker with the proper training—typically through years of apprenticeship. These skilled martial artists utilize their abundant knowledge of the body's "fresh" and "saltwater" energy meridians to heal with acupuncture and tattoos, but also to precisely debilitate their foes. In Ilridun, any ship or group with a physiker, especially one sponsored by the Medica Meridia, is afforded additional respect and deference by Ilridun's citizens. Given the city's position as a bustling naval hub, physikers can often be found on land and sea across the world, carried by the tides of fate towards their inevitable destinies.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The undulator deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Tendrilous Aura
entries: The ground within 60 feet of the undulator is filled with mindless, writhing tentacles made of shadow that extend 5 feet into the air. A hostile creature's speed is halved in the area, it has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or escape being {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained}, and opportunity attacks against it are made with advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The undulator can use its Resonate. It then makes three attacks, only one of which can be with its beak.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The undulator has twelve tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

action.name: Resonate {@recharge 5}
entries: The undulator emits a sonorous, mind-altering tone. Each creature within 60 feet of the undulator that can hear it must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the undulator for 1 hour. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the undulator has a telepathic link with the creature and always knows the creature's location as long as it and the creature are on the same plane of existence.

Whenever the undulator or one of its allies deals damage to the {@condition charmed} creature, the creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the undulator's Resonate for the next 24 hours.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The undulator makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.
It can do so using its senses, or using the senses of one creature of its choice that is {@condition charmed} by it.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The undulator moves up to its speed.

legendary.name: Compelled Strike (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: The undulator magically forces one creature {@condition charmed} by it to use its reaction, if available, to make an attack against a target of the undulator's choice that it can see.

legendary.name: Tentacle Slam (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The undulator slams creatures {@condition grappled} by it into each other or a solid surface. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the undulator's next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

The Terror of the Deep, the Shadow's Tentacles, the Droning Kraken—all of these are names used to describe the horrific undulator. Eyeless yet ever-watching, this inscrutable, aberrant entity of unknown origins lurks within the deepest shadowy recesses of the earth. Just to be near the monstrous thing is to risk shattering the psyche, as its suckered physical and shadowy magical tendrils lash out indiscriminately. To make matters worse, it even possesses potent, mind-altering magic that imposes its own will over its prey, charming them into submission and obedience. In some parts of Ilridun, even speaking its name is taboo, seen as a potential invitation of its presence.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The troll can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The troll has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The troll regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the troll takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the troll's next turn. The troll dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Stench
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the troll must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of the creature's next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the stench of all bog trolls for 1 hour.

trait.name: Swamp Camouflage
entries: The troll has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The troll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fetid Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) poison damage.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: In the first round of a combat, the serpent has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it {@status surprised}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the serpent is in water, a creature that hasn't observed it move or act must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that it isn't a row of cat tails or swamp grass.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The serpent can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

trait.name: Rapid Spin
entries: If the serpent hasn't moved on its turn, it can use its Death Roll as a bonus action. After it uses this bonus action, its speed is 0 until the end of the current turn.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 4d4}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}).
Until this grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained}, and the serpent can't constrict another target.

action.name: Death Roll
entries: The serpent thrashes and spins violently. When it does so, it can make a {@dc 12} Strength check, freeing itself from all effects causing it to be {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} on a success. If the serpent is grappling another creature when it performs this maneuver, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of the serpent's next turn.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the goose can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Batter
entries: If the goose is within 5 feet of a {@condition prone} creature, it can make one attack with its wings against the creature as a bonus action.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The goose has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goose makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its wings.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wings
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Honk {@recharge 5}
entries: The goose releases a terrifying blast of sonic energy. Each creature within 60 feet of it must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}. If a creature fails the saving throw by 5 or more, it is also {@condition frightened} until the end of the goose's next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature's speed is reduced to 0.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marshwarden is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). It knows the following ranger spells:

spells: {@spell find steed} (takes the form of a Large giant frog)

trait.name: Blowgun Adept
entries: When the marshwarden is hidden from a creature and misses it with a ranged attack using a blowgun, making the attack doesn't reveal the marshwarden's position.

trait.name: Fluid Movement
entries: The marshwarden can move across liquids on its turn without falling during the move.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The marshwarden can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The marshwarden's long jump is up to 15 and its high jump is up to 5, with or without a running start.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marshwarden makes two attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blowgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 100 ft., one target. {@h}5 piercing damage plus 8 acid or poison damage (marshwarden's choice), and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of the marshwarden's next turn.

reaction.name: Poisonous Defense (4/Day)
entries: When an attacker that the marshwarden can see hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attacker takes 11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) acid or poison damage (marshwarden's choice).

trait.name: Acid Absorption
entries: Whenever the ooze is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the acid damage dealt.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Damage Transfer
entries: While enveloping a creature, the ooze takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a puddle of swamp muck.

trait.name: Swamp Stride
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs the ooze no extra movement. It can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a  similar hazard.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Envelop
entries: The ooze lunges at a Large or smaller creature it can see within 10 feet of it. The target must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the ooze lands in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target. On a failed save, the ooze enters the target's space as it envelops the target's body with its mucky form, and the target takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage.

While enveloped, the target's speed is halved, it has disadvantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and Dexterity saving throws, and it takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) acid damage at the start of each of the ooze's turns. When the target moves, the ooze moves with it. If the ooze exits the target's space, the target is no longer enveloped and this effect ends.

An enveloped target can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 12} Strength check. On a success, the ooze falls to the ground in its space, and the target escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the ooze.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The deck of cards is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the deck of cards must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the deck of cards remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal deck of cards.

action.name: Fling Card
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

Like other animated constructs, the animated deck of cards exists seemingly only to surprise unknowing creatures. Swirling around a central deck of cards, these sharp, flying cards fling themselves haphazardly toward targets to inflict wicked paper cuts and ruin game nights.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The card shark is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the card shark must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the card shark remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal pile of scattered playing cards.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The card shark can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the card shark can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny playing card. The card shark can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The card shark makes four fling card attacks. If it has half of its hit points or fewer, it instead makes two fling card attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) piercing damage, or 13 ({@damage 3d8}) piercing damage if the card shark has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Fling Card
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Card Volley (1/Day)
entries: The card shark hurls a flurry of cards in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the card shark has half its hit points or fewer, each creature instead takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

When animated decks of cards collect in large enough groups, they sometimes form an even larger, shark-like form. These cards fly in tandem and work together under a shared consciousness like a school of fish. In this form, the card shark can fling cards like a normal animated deck, but also bite down and viciously slice its prey with its hundreds of blade-like cards.

trait.name: Ace in the Hole (1/Day)
entries: When the master makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20}, it can choose to treat the roll as a 20 instead.

trait.name: Gaming Adept
entries: The master has advantage on any ability check it makes that involves a gaming set.

trait.name: Scatter Dice
entries: As a bonus action, the master spreads a flurry of dice on the ground in a 15-foot cone. The area becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-square portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand. When a creature moves into the area and each time it moves 5 feet within the area, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check or fall {@condition prone} and take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Wildcard
entries: When the master makes an attack roll, if the {@dice d20} roll is a 7, the attack hits regardless of any modifiers or the target's AC, and the attack is a critical hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The master makes three fling card attacks.

action.name: Fling Card
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Dragonchess Summon (1/Day)
entries: The master throws a dragonchess piece into an unoccupied space the master can see within 30 feet of it, magically summoning the creature represented by the piece. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or after 10 minutes.

The creature is friendly to the master and its companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that the master issues to it (no action required by the master). If the master doesn't issue any commands to the creature, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.
Roll a {@dice d6} to determine the creature the master summons.
Griffon
Basilisk
Red dragon wyrmling
Unicorn
Earth elemental
Mammoth

Creatures that spend enough time playing games eventually come to understand them in strange and powerful ways, seeing them in a way unlike their fellow players. These masters can easily win at cards, chess, or dice because of their staggering experience and uncanny luck, but can also bring out the bizarre magical powers hidden within such trinkets.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The mimic can use its action to polymorph into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 15}). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) piercing damage plus 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

Mimics that venture outside of their normal dungeon homes sometimes take on the form of abandoned carts, having found that travelers often investigate such objects in search of wealth or, less frequently, to see if someone inside needs help. These mimics employ similar tactics as their dungeon-dwelling relatives, but tend to encounter (and devour) more helpless folk than the average mimic as a result of their size and feeding grounds.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Cleric/Mage/Paladin)
headerEntries: The swarm's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: The swarm is incapacitated while in the area of an {@spell antimagic field}. If targeted by {@spell dispel magic}, the swarm must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

trait.name: Superior Invisibility (Sylph; 1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the sylph piece can cast {@spell greater invisibility} on the swarm.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: When one of the dragonchess pieces acts, it momentarily increases to Medium size in the swarm's space before reverting to its normal Tiny form. If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, it can't cast spells, and it can't use its Fire Breath or Uncanny Dodge options.

The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny dragonchess piece. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swarm makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its crush, and one with its sword; it can cast a spell in place of one attack. If the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer, it instead makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its sword.

action.name: Bite (Basilisk/Griffon)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Crush (Dwarf/Oliphant)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sword (Hero/Warrior)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath (Dragon; Recharge 6)
entries: The dragon piece exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Healing Touch (Unicorn; 2/Day)
entries: The unicorn piece touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 11 ({@dice 2d8 + 2}) hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target.

reaction.name: Fiery Retaliation (Elemental)
entries: When a creature touches the swarm or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, the elemental piece deals 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage to that creature.

reaction.name: Overrule (King; 1/Day)
entries: When the swarm misses with an attack, the king piece orders it to reroll the attack roll, and it must use the new roll.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge (Thief)
entries: The thief piece halves the damage that the swarm takes from an attack that hits it. The swarm must be able to see the attacker.

Dragonchess pieces that have been enchanted by beguiling wizards, artificers, and game masters sometimes become fully autonomous, much like their deck of card counterparts. These pieces rattle about and take turns enlarging and attacking, behaving like a legion of humanoids and beasts working together in deadly partnership.

trait.name: Coven Cart
entries: The wagon counts as a hag for the purpose of forming a coven with two other hags.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wagon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Soul Capture
entries: If the wagon or one of its allies riding in it kills a humanoid, that creature's soul becomes trapped in the demiplane inside the wagon. A trapped soul remains in the demiplane until the wagon is destroyed, or until it is targeted by a {@spell dispel evil and good} spell or similar magic, releasing all trapped souls.

While a creature's soul is trapped in the demiplane, a hag riding in the wagon can use an action to magically transform, assuming that creature's appearance. While transformed, the hag gains access to enough information that it can reliably pass itself off as that creature to a casual acquaintance of the creature.

A creature can discern the hag's true nature by succeeding on a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check contested by the hag's Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check. The hag reverts to its normal form if it is ever more than 1 mile away from the wagon.

trait.name: Witch's Spire
entries: The wagon can use a bonus action to assume its Gargantuan spire form, standing on chicken-like legs and raising the wagon 30 feet into the air. It stays in this form until it uses a bonus action to revert to its wagon form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wagon makes two snatch attacks.

action.name: Snatch (Spire Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}. The wagon has two arms, each of which can grapple only one target. A humanoid reduced to 0 hit points while {@condition grappled} in this way dies and is subjected to the wagon's Soul Capture trait.

action.name: Overrun
entries: The wagon moves up to its speed in a straight line.

During this movement, it can move through the space of any creature or object that is Large or smaller, and it doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. Each target in its path must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 19 ({@damage 3d12}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

A favored and bewitched ally of hags, wicked wagons are animated carts with sickly demiplanes inside that hold captured souls. These souls can then be used by its hag allies to transform their appearances, taking on the forms and basic knowledge of the souls captured within.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The darkmantle's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Darkmantle Aura
entries: Darkmantles within 120 feet of the elder darkmantle have resistance to psychic damage and advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

In addition, when a darkmantle within 120 feet of the elder darkmantle (including itself) scores a critical hit, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or gain a random form of short-term madness; this effect lasts for {@dice 1d10} minutes.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The darkmantle can't use its blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a Huge cave formation such as a wall, stalactite, or stalagmite.

trait.name: Psychic Defense
entries: The darkmantle's AC includes its Intelligence modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The darkmantle makes two crush attacks. It can cast a spell in place of one attack.

action.name: Crush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Huge or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target's head, and the target is also {@condition blinded} and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.

While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.
A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful {@dc 15} Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

action.name: Darkness Aura (2/Day)
entries: A 30-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains {@status concentration}, up to 10 minutes (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled. Hostile creatures within the darkness have disadvantage on saving throws against the darkmantle's spells.

action.name: Overwhelm {@recharge 5}
entries: The elder darkmantle psionically commands nearby darkmantles to swarm a target it chooses.
Each darkmantle within 120 feet of the elder darkmantle (not including itself) can immediately use its reaction to move up to its speed toward the target and make one melee weapon attack against it.

Like their smaller relatives, elder darkmantles thrive in darkness. However, elder darkmantles are massive by comparison, and exude an psionic aura from them that controls nearby darkmantles and enhances their natural abilities.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Defensive Combatant
entries: Hostile creatures provoke opportunity attacks from the knight when they enter its reach. If the knight takes the Dodge or Search action, it has advantage on opportunity attacks until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two glaive attacks. It can take the Dodge or Search action in place of one attack.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

The knights of Polaris are qualified enforcement agents in their own right, but the elite knights of the city stand head and shoulders above the rest in terms of raw strength and tactical know-how. Polaris elite knights are usually left to manage groups of other knights or mind the wellfare and daily tasks of the Magistrates.

monster.name: Polaris Magistrate
languages: Common plus up to five other languages

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The magistrate is an 18th-level spellcaster.

Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The magistrate can cast magic missile and detect thoughts at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The magistrate casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The magistrate has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands.

Powerful archmages in their own right, the Magistrates of Polaris are long-lived and exceedingly wealthy leaders of the floating city. Almost uniformly lawful in nature and ideology, Magistrates are renowned across the multiverse for their influential standing in cross-planar trade and mediation. Those who attempt to assassinate or otherwise overthrow a Magistrate are universally met with a terrifying, and certainly life-ending, display of arcane skill.

monster.name: Sentry Golem

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to half the fire damage dealt. In addition, if its Flamethrower is not charged, it immediately recharges.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Restricted Propulsion
entries: The golem can only fly up to 15 feet off the ground.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The golem has advantage on ability checks and saving throws against effects that would move it or knock it {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Flamethrower {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem releases a burst of flames in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
The fire spreads around corners, and it ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

action.name: Knockout Gas (2/Day)
entries: The golem launches a canister of sleep-inducing gas to a point it can see within 60 feet of it, which immediately expels its contents on impact. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute.
This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

The sentry golems of Polaris are smaller and more easily produced than their larger constructed brethren, such as the iron golem or shield guardian. These city defenders and riot-controlling arcane machines are capable of limited flight, and can launch a salvo of flames or sleeping gas from its arm-mounted canister attachment.

trait.name: Alien Animation
entries: When the symbiote kills a humanoid with a melee attack or touches a humanoid corpse, a piece of itself attaches to the creature's body and reanimates it.
The reanimated creature is friendly to the symbiote and has the statistics of a zombie, but it has a flying speed of 20 feet and can hover.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The symbiote can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Space Camouflage
entries: The symbiote has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in Wild Space or the Astral Plane.

trait.name: Symbiotic Bond
entries: The symbiote knows the distance and direction to each creature it has reanimated as long as it and the creature are on the same plane of existence. In addition, it can magically communicate simple ideas and images with any such creature.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

A space symbiote is a pitch-dark ooze that travels through the Astral Plane and Cosmos in seach of living, or even once-living, matter. Cosmos-faring humanoids consumed by it are posthumously reanimated, becoming mindless thralls of the otherwise aimless ooze as it travels the universe in search of its next meal.

trait.name: Ephemeral
entries: The phenomena can't wear or carry anything.

trait.name: Magic Immunity
entries: The phenomena can't be affected or detected by spells or other magical effects, and the properties of magic items used against it are ignored. For example, a +1 longsword used to attack the phenomena functions as a nonmagical longsword.

action.name: Energy Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage.

action.name: Energy Surge {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 15 feet of the phenomena must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

These strange, trans-dimensional beings of pure force are from another reality where starmetal can still be found. Named after the late Conjuration Magistrate who discovered them, Julius Staver, the Polaris Magistrates are in constant opposition with these alien creatures as they desperately seeks to reach and harvest more starmetal from their dimension. Other than in defense of themselves or their home, the Staver Phenomena don't actively seek conquest or violence.

fly.condition: (use creature's speed in beast or humanoid form)

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Duvra's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}). Duvra can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Duvra fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Duvra can use his action to polymorph into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than his own, or into a Medium or larger silver dragon, or back into his true form, which is a young silver dragon. His statistics, other than his speed, are the same in each form, as appropriate to his form; for example, in the form of a panther, he would have a walking speed of 50 feet and a climbing speed of 40 feet, and he wouldn't be able to use his tail attack. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. He reverts to his true form if he dies.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (Humanoid Form Only; 1/Turn)
entries: Duvra deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) damage when he hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Duvra that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and Duvra doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Duvra can use his Frightful Presence. In beast or dragon form, he then makes three attacks: one with his bite and two with his claws, if able. In humanoid form, he instead makes two attacks with his daggers.

action.name: Bite (Beast or Dragon Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft. (or 15 ft. if Gargantuan), one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw (Beast or Dragon Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft. (or 10 ft. if Gargantuan), one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail (Beast or Dragon Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft. (or 20 ft. if Gargantuan), one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dagger (Humanoid Form Only)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d4 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence (Dragon Form Only)
entries: Each creature of Duvra's choice that is within 120 feet of him and aware of him must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to Duvra's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: Duvra uses one of the following breath weapons.

action.name: Cold Breath
entries: Duvra exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone.
Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking 67 ({@damage 15d8}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Polymorphing Breath
entries: Duvra exhales a wave of shapechanging magic in a 90-foot cone. An unwilling creature in the area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw to resist the transformation, and an unwilling shapechanger automatically succeeds on the save.

The transformation lasts on each target for 1 minute, until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies, or until Duvra's {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). The new form is the same for each target and can be any beast whose challenge rating is equal to or less than that of the target with the lowest challenge rating that failed the save (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality.
Each target assumes the hit points of its new form.

When it reverts to its normal form, the target returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the target's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked {@condition unconscious}. The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form. The target can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.

legendary.name: Hide/Seek
entries: Duvra makes a Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) check or a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Duvra moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Tail Attack (Beast or Dragon Form Only)
entries: Duvra makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Dragon Form Only; Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Duvra beats his wings. Each creature within 15 feet of Duvra must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. Duvra can then fly up to half his flying speed.

As the guardian and patron of Breezeport, the metallic dragon Duvra is a mighty force of chaos and good. Through his copious use of transmutation magic and polymorphing effects, the trickster has mastered the art of shapechanging and altered his very essence accordingly. Although his age and power mean that his true form is still that of a behemoth dragon, he considers the form of a younger dragon or humanoid to be a better representation of his capricious soul.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fanaticist is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

spells: {@spell mage hand} (appears as a dragon's claw)

trait.name: Duvran Devotion
entries: The fanaticist has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and against any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The fanaticist deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the fanaticist that isn't incapacitated and the fanaticist doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.
Covetous cultists devoted to praising Duvra's trickery—and matching it in kind with their own. Duvran fanatacists range from seemingly deranged swindlers to master cutpurses.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The feathered mask leader is an 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It knows the following bard spells:

trait.name: Emphatic Enchantment (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the Feathered Mask leader can temporarily empower its magical prowess. The next time the Feathered Mask leader casts a spell before the end of its turn, it can give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The guild leader has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Feathered Mask leader makes two attacks with its rapier or hand crossbow. It can cast a spell of 3rd level or lower in place of one attack.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

The current Feathered Mask leader, Daisy Z, is a powerful spellcaster and masterful socialite. Her work to establish a reknowned and respected organization of companions is nothing short of impressive, and is capable of defending herself and her own with or without force, as necessary.

monster.name: Greille
languages: understands Common and Sylvan but can't speak

trait.name: Cheeky Thief
entries: The inside of the greille's cheeks are connected to an extradimensional space. This extradimensional space can hold up to 50 pounds of Tiny objects, not exceeding a volume of 2 cubic feet. The greille can magically retrieve any object it chooses from the extradimensional space as a bonus action on its turn. If the greille dies, the contents of its extradimensional space spill forth from its body in the nearest unoccupied space to it.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The greille has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The greille can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

Commonly called pilfurrs, these chipmunk-like fey are a frequent nuisance to travelers and shoppers. Greille are incredibly adept at sneaking into purses and bags, stuffing whatever coins and small objects they can find into their expansive cheeks before running off again. Their burrows can contain anything from gold and gems to worthless collections of junk. Some burrows in Breezeport are already known to Duvra, having spent time disguised as a greille himself, and he'll help himself to anything of value he finds there to add to his own hoard.

trait.name: Brawler
entries: If the bruiser successfully grapples or shoves a creature on its turn, or if it is already grappling a creature at the start of its turn, it can use its bonus action to make one fist attack against that creature.

trait.name: Brute
entries: The bruiser deals one extra die of damage when it hits a creature with a melee attack (included in the attack).

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the bruiser is wearing no armor, its AC includes its Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bruiser makes two fist attacks. It can attempt to grapple or shove a creature in place of any attack.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

Musclemen and women working for illicit seafaring privateers—pirates—can also find work in taverns as guards and other means of intimidation. Bruisers typically prefer to use their fists before other weapons, and can pummel targets and grapple them into submission with ease.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the demolitionist is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the demolitionist instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Trap Adept
entries: The demolitionist has advantage on any ability check it makes to set, disarm, or search for traps.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demolitionist makes two rapier attacks.
It can use its demolitionist's fire or bomb in place of one attack.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Demolitionist's Fire (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 15/30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage. Hit or miss, each creature within 5 feet of the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or ignite. A flammable object in the area that isn't being worn or carried automatically ignites. Until a creature uses an action to extinguish a creature or object ignited in this way, it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Bomb (3/Day)
entries: The demolitionist ignites the fuse of one of its handheld bombs, tossing the bomb to a point it can see within 30 feet of it. The bomb then detonates, exploding in a 10-foot-radius sphere of fire and shrapnel. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners and ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried.

Sailors with a penchant for the explosive are demoltionists. On vessels with cannonry, these characters often serve as their munitions experts and fire mitigation experts. On vessels without, demoltionists find satisfying work with makeshift bombs using small explosives and alchemical know-how.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The navigator is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The navigator has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Navigation Expert
entries: The navigator has advantage on any ability check it makes that involves navigator's tools.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

Ships need navigators to direct them through dangerous weather conditions. Sea navigators that rise to the top will often be capable of exercising a degree of control over such weather, allowing them to either avoid, dismiss, or create such hazards to the ship's benefit.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Lightning Body
entries: If the druid is hit by a melee attack while it has temporary hit points from its Lightning Leap action, the attacker takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) lightning damage.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit ({@hit 7} to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage with shillelagh.

action.name: Lightning Leap (2/Day)
entries: The druid transforms into a streaking bolt of lightning, which surges forward in a line that's 5 feet wide and up to 60 feet long in a direction it chooses. The druid returns to its normal form in the nearest unoccupied space at the end of the line. Twice while transformed, it can stop the line short and continue in a different direction for up to the remaining length of the line before transforming back into its normal form.

Each creature within the line of lightning must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 21 ({@damage 2d10 + 10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The druid then returns to its normal form and gains 15 temporary hit points. These temporary hit points remain for 10 minutes.

Members of a circle of druids that revere the might of the world's tempests, storm druids sometimes find passage on ships around as navigators themselves. Druids of this circle can transform their bodies into streaking bolts of lightning, allowing them to reach far-flung locations in a single (dangerous) bound.

monster.name: Behitaur
languages: Draconic plus one other language (usually Common or Elvish)

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the behitaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a pike attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The behitaur makes two ranged attacks or two melee attacks, but can constrict only once.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the behitaur can't constrict another target.

action.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Breath {@recharge}
entries: The behitaur exhales a line of lightning that is 15 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Behitaurs are many-legged half-human, half-behir monstrosities in much the same way that a centaur is half human and half horse. The Lesser Reflectore Anillos are magically cursed and transformed into behitaurs as a result of their destiny-defying heressy and consumption.

monster.name: Bell Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Bastion
entries: The golem's lower body resembles a small temple.

Up to eight Medium or smaller creatures can ride in it without squeezing. Any creatures inside the golem can't make melee attacks against creatures outside it, but several openings allow them to make ranged attacks and create other ranged effects at a distance. Creatures in the golem have three-quarters cover against attacks and effects from outside it, and they are immune to effects created by the golem. If the golem dies, creatures in the golem are placed in unoccupied spaces within 5 feet of it.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Sympathetic Vibrations
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to thunder damage, it takes no damage and its bell reverberates with a thunderous ring. Each creature within 30 feet of the golem must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take thunder damage equal to half the damage dealt by the attack or effect.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two stomp attacks.

action.name: Stomp
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Time Cacophony {@recharge}
entries: The golem causes its bell to ring out in a discordant clattering of tones. Each creature within 60 feet of the golem that can hear it must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and time is altered around it, causing it to suffer the effects of the {@spell slow} spell for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

A bell golem is an enormous, four-legged golem in the form of a temple or similar sort of belltower. These golems often lie dormant until needed, typically at the behest of their creators or some other means of activation. Bell golems are frequently used as meeting places for cults, often without the cultists even knowing of the golem's existence.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is an 8th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Blessing of the Bell
entries: The priest adds its Wisdom modifier to its initiative rolls.

trait.name: Holy Clangor (Recharges After a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the priest can cause a faint, divine ringing to emanate from it for 1 minute. Each friendly creature within 10 feet of the priest that hears the sound (including the priest) can immediately make a saving throw against one effect on it that's causing it to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. A hostile creature within 10 feet of the priest that hears the sound instead takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage. For the duration, the priest can use a bonus action on each of its subsequent turns to send out the wave again.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) thunder damage.

reaction.name: Frightful Knell (2/Day)
entries: When a creature the priest can see within 60 feet of it is reduced to 0 hit points, the priest causes a foretelling death knell to emit from that creature.

The death knell is audible out to a range of 10 feet, and each creature the priest chooses that can hear it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} of the triggering target (or whatever is left of it) until the end of its next turn. A {@condition frightened} creature is {@condition incapacitated} for the duration as it contemplates its own mortality. Each time the creature takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

The fanatical priests of Gavia who worship the toll of the Capilla's twin bells are carillon priests. Other carillon priests exist throughout the world, but the ones in Gavia are particularly zealous in their piety and narrow scope. Typical carillon priests revere all bells, not just Alegría and Aflicción, and believe that the ringing of bells is simply the shared language of gods on the Material Plane.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The doom ringer is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Pandemoniacal Devotion
entries: The doom ringer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition deafened} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Piercing Prophet
entries: The doom ringer is unaffected by the {@spell silence} spell. In addition, creatures within the area of a {@spell silence} spell cast by the doom ringer can still hear the doom ringer and aren't immune to thunder damage dealt by the doom ringer.

action.name: Light Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

A doom ringer is a feverish acolyte of Los Fieles. They walk the streets of Gavia quietly ringing small, well-worn hand bells. The most maddened of doom ringers believe that to live without the sound of the bells for even a moment is to live in aversion to destiny, and therefore are heretical to their core beliefs.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The crow doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and if the target is a Small or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the crow can't use its talons on another target.

action.name: Screech {@recharge}
entries: The crow emits a thunderous screech. Each creature within 30 feet of the crow must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} until the end of the crow's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

Cacophony crows are dark, but brassy in color and can imitate the sound and even resonance of temple bells. Some crows are trained to take the place of bells in buildings with limited space or resources, and can even be used to tell time, with enough patience, in much the same way that a belltower chimes throughout the day.

In the wild, the crows use their raucous calls to startle and disarm potential prey, or even mislead wandering travelers with a false promise of faraway civilization. A group of cacophony crows is called a crashing.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The swarm doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Medium cacophony crow. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Beaks
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) piercing damage, or 18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 6d4 + 4}) piercing damage, or 14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the swarm can't use its talons on another target.

action.name: Screech {@recharge 4}
entries: The swarm emits a thunderous screech. Each creature within 90 feet of the swarm must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) thunder damage and is {@condition stunned} for 1 minute; a {@condition stunned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

Cacophony crows are dark, but brassy in color and can imitate the sound and even resonance of temple bells. Some crows are trained to take the place of bells in buildings with limited space or resources, and can even be used to tell time, with enough patience, in much the same way that a belltower chimes throughout the day.

In the wild, the crows use their raucous calls to startle and disarm potential prey, or even mislead wandering travelers with a false promise of faraway civilization. A group of cacophony crows is called a crashing.

trait.name: Dream Sight
entries: The dragon can see any living creature within 120 feet of it like normal, even if the creature is lightly or heavily obscured.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hypnotic Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed} for 1 minute. While {@condition charmed} in this way, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed of 0. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If an affected creature takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to attempt to shake the creature out of its stupor, the creature can repeat the saving throw with advantage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Hypnotic Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

action.name: Phantasmal Breath
entries: The dragon exhales a cloud of obscuring sand in a 60-foot cone. The cloud remains until the end of the dragon's next turn, and its area is lightly obscured.

Each creature in the cloud when it appears must make a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw as the dragon magically crafts illusory manifestations of each creature's deepest fears within the cloud. A target takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Sleep Breath
entries: The dragon exhales sleep gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition unconscious} for 1 hour; a creature has disadvantage on this saving throw if it is under the effects of the dragon's Hypnotic Presence. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The dragon magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or uses its breath weapon, or until its {@status concentration} ends (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). Any equipment the dragon wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Sandstorm (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon causes a torrent of sand to buffet the area around itself. Each creature other than the dragon within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or take 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

Dream dragons lord over their lairs in The Grephearon's Dream Gallery, enjoying the unique magics that radiate off of their collected gallery paintings. They magically turn invisible when exploring the gallery's labyrinth in search of new treasures, interesting dreams, or visiting humanoids. When within a dream, a dragon attempts to devour other outsider creatures—those not belonging to the dream. To the dragon, these morsels, while not truly necessary for their survival, are nevertheless a delicious treat.

trait.name: Wretched Strikes
entries: If the dream eater hits a creature with two greatclub attacks in the same turn, the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or fall {@condition prone} and become {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the dream eater's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dream eater makes two greatclub attacks.
It can attempt to grapple a creature in place of one attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit (with advantage if the target is {@condition grappled} by the dream eater or {@condition incapacitated}), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Devour Hope {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature the dream eater chooses within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw; a target makes this saving throw with disadvantage if it is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and becomes {@condition frightened} of the dream eater for 1 minute. The {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition frightened}. If damage from this effect reduces a creature to 0 hit points but doesn't kill it, it immediately suffers one death saving throw failure as it is filled with dread.

Dream eaters are headless, lumbering giantfolk with taut mouths stretched across their midsections. They patrol the hallways of the Dream Gallery in search of ne'er-do-well dreamwalkers. Dream eaters can smell the magical residue of the dreamwalk spell (as described on page 7, hunting down the source of the spell over time. Once found, the dream eaters either attack the caster or consume the painting the caster is currently inside. The dream then collapses and shunts the caster out into the dream eater's stomach.

monster.name: Insombie
languages: understands all languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit; the zombie has advantage on this saving throw if it has inflicted at least one level of {@condition exhaustion} since the start of its last turn. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or suffer one level of {@condition exhaustion}. Any levels of {@condition exhaustion} inflicted by this effect go away when the target finishes a short or long rest.
Insombies are the risen undead of those who have died of exhaustion. These wandering zombie-like creatures radiate tiredness and inflict levels of exhaustion to those within their reach.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The night terror's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The night terror can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The night terror can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form, but it can only use its flying speed in humanoid form if it's polymorphed into a race that is able to fly. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Aura of Fear
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of the night terror have disadvantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}, and {@condition frightened} creatures in the aura have disadvantage on saving throws against the night terror's spells and effects. In addition, the night terror gains 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of its turns for each creature within this aura that is {@condition frightened}. 14 THE GRIFFON'S SADDLEBAG

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement (True Form Only)
entries: The night terror can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The night terror has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The night terror makes two attacks with its Nightmarish Touch. It can cast a spell in place of one attack.

action.name: Nightmarish Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit (with advantage if the target is {@condition frightened}), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Torrent of Terror {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the night terror must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} as it is flooded with horrific visions of its deepest fears. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature's speed is reduced to 0, and it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) psychic damage if it starts its turn within 30 feet of the night terror. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Shapeshifting specters made of protomatter themselves, night terrors are aptly named. These undead harbingers of misery emanate fear wherever they go and cause their prey to wither and lose all sense of hope in their wake. When invading the dreams of creatures, a terror transforms any dream into a horrifying experience.

trait.name: Apparition {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action, or as part of the bonus action the barbarian uses to enter a rage, it can teleport up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space it can see that is within 5 feet of another creature. That creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the barbarian until the start of the barbarian's next turn. A creature {@condition frightened} in this way can speak only falteringly and can't make opportunity attacks against the barbarian, and the barbarian has advantage on attack rolls against the creature.

trait.name: Rage (3/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the barbarian can enter a rage that lasts for 1 minute. The rage ends early if the barbarian is knocked {@condition unconscious} or if its turn ends and it hasn't attacked a hostile creature or taken damage since its last turn. While raging, the barbarian gains the following benefits: y It has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. y It gains a +2 bonus to the damage roll of any melee weapon attacks it makes (included in the attack). y The first creature it hits on each of its turns with a weapon attack takes an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage. y It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the barbarian can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The barbarian makes two attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, or 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage while raging.

Barbarians that are driven by their innermost turmoil as much as they are their anger. Using bizarre magic pulled seemingly straight from The Grephearon, these brutal warriors are capable of striking bone-chilling fear into those whom they stalk from the shadows.
